de.mrapp.apriori

Class TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.apriori.TieBreaker<T>
      • de.mrapp.apriori.TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<ItemSet>
    Enclosing class:
    TieBreaker<T>

    public static class TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker
extends TieBreaker<T>
    A tie-breaking strategy, which applies to item sets.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class de.mrapp.apriori.TieBreaker

    • Method Detail

      • preferSmall

        @NotNull
public final @NotNull TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker preferSmall()
        Adds an additional criteria to the current tie-breaking strategy, which prefers small item sets over large ones. I.e., if an item set contains less items than its counterpart, it is sorted before the other one.
        Returns:
        The tie-breaking strategy, including the added criteria, as an instance of the class TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker. The tie breaking-strategy may not be null

      • preferLarge

        @NotNull
public final @NotNull TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker preferLarge()
        Adds an additional criteria to the current tie-breaking strategy, which prefers large item sets over small ones. I.e., if an item set contains more items than its counterpart, it is sorted before the other one.
        Returns:
        The tie-breaking strategy, including the added criteria, as an instance of the class TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker. The tie breaking-strategy may not be null

      • custom

        @NotNull
public final @NotNull TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker custom(@NotNull
                                                                   @NotNull java.util.Comparator<ItemSet> comparator)
        Adds an additional custom criteria to the current tie-breaking strategy. The given comparator must return 1, if the first association rule should be preferred, -1, if the second one should be preferred or 0, if no decision could be made.
        Parameters:
        comparator - The comparator, which specifies which one of two item sets or association rules should be sorted before the other one when performing tie-breaking, as an instance of the type Comparator. The comparator may not be null
        Returns:
        The tie-breaking strategy, including the added criteria, as an instance of the class TieBreaker.ItemSetTieBreaker. The tie breaking-strategy may not be null
